description: Users may observe unauthorized access to sensitive information, such as registry key values, that they would typically have no permission to view. This exposure can lead to serious data privacy concerns as attackers might manipulate legitimate users into unknowingly revealing this information. The systems affected include various builds of Windows 10 and Windows Server, as detailed in KB articles such as KB-5035859 and others. Depending on the build number, the specific Windows versions impacted range from 10.0.10240.20526 to 10.0.22631.3296. This information disclosure occurs without the need for user interaction, emphasizing the importance of applying the corresponding security updates promptly to mitigate risks.
